Class QuickFood2

java.lang.Object
QuickFood2
public class QuickFood2 extends Object
QuickFood2 is a food delivery system for a company called "Quick Food". QuickFood is a company that receives orders from a client, and distributes them to a driver based on their current load and their location. This class ensures that orders are distributed accordingly.
Author:
Henri Branken

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException
      The ultimate goal of the main(...) function is to generate an invoice based on particulars captured from the user.
      Parameters:
      args - No String array is passed to this main method.
      Throws:
      IOException - A Problem has occured while trying to output the invoice data to INVOICE_FP.

    • prettyAddress

      public static String prettyAddress(String input)
      Takes an input address in which the fields are separated by commas, and converts it into a string in which the fields are separated by newlines `\n`.
      Parameters:
      input - Customer Address information in which the fields are comma delimited.
      Returns:
      A formatted string in which the fields are delimited by newlines. This makes the invoice output more user-friendly to read.

    • prettyNumber

      public static String prettyNumber(String num)
      Converts an input number (of type String) to the following format: xxx xxx xxxx. This makes the contact numbers more user-friendly to read in the invoice.
      Parameters:
      num - The contact number of either the client or the restaurant.
      Returns:
      The contact number in the specified xxx xxx xxxx String format.

    • capFirstLetter

      public static String capFirstLetter(String raw)
      Capitalizes the first letter of a raw String.
      Parameters:
      raw - A string whose first letter is not necessarily capitalized.
      Returns:
      A string whose first letter is definitely capitalized (for characters of the Latin alphabet at least).

    • getDriver

      public static String getDriver(String cityToMatch) throws IOException, ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
      Get a driver with the smallest load in the given city if possible (it might be the case that the customer resides in an area unreachable by Quick Food services).
      Parameters:
      cityToMatch - The city we need to filter against in our driver database, drivers-info.txt.
      Returns:
      The name of the driver in cityToMatch with the smallest load. If there are no drivers in cityToMatch, then return the String "none" to the caller.
      Throws:
      IOException - Occurs if the drivers-info.txt file is corrupted or cannot be opened.
      ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - Typically occurs when there is a NULL value in a row in drivers-info.txt such that the data for a driver cannot be parsed properly.

    • printInvoice

      public static String printInvoice(Customer cObj, Restaurant rObj, String chosenDriver)
      Capture all the details from both the customer (`cObj`) and restaurant (`rObj`) objects, and write the contents to the text file "src/data/invoice.txt".
      Parameters:
      cObj - The Customer object.
      rObj - The Restaurant object.
      chosenDriver - The name of the driver assigned to the particular order. Note that the city of the driver is the same as that of the customer.
      Returns:
      A large String value containing all the invoice information to be written to an external text file, "src/data/invoice.txt". The actual writing to invoice.txt takes place in the main clause.
